description:
Next.js Egg for Pterodactyl using a standalone pnpm binary.

 This Egg is designed to run Next.js applications using pnpm as the package manager. It includes a startup script that checks for the presence of a package.json file, installs pnpm if it's not already present, and then installs the necessary dependencies before starting the application.

To use this Egg, simply upload your Next.js application files to the server, ensuring that your package.json file is included. You can customize the startup command using the provided environment variable.

Make sure to set the appropriate Node.js version in the Docker image selection based on your application's requirements.

Enjoy building and deploying your Next.js applications with ease! 

Note: This Egg assumes that you have a basic understanding of how to use Pterodactyl and manage Node.js applications. 

If you encounter any issues or have questions, feel free to reach out for support.

startup: if [ ! -f /home/container/package.json ]; then echo 'Error: package.json not found!'; exit 1; fi; if [ ! -f /home/container/pnpm ]; then echo 'Downloading pnpm...'; curl -L https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/releases/latest/download/pnpm-linux-x64 -o /home/container/pnpm; chmod +x /home/container/pnpm; fi; ./pnpm install; ./{{STARTUP_CMD}}

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Next.js App Installation Script
export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
apt update
apt install -y curl unzip git wget

mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

echo "Downloading pnpm binary..."
wget -qO- https://get.pnpm.io/install.sh | ENV="$HOME/.bashrc" SHELL="$(which bash)" bash -
source /root/.bashrc

echo "Install Complete"
exit 0
